concise_definition: adj. 没钱的, 穷困的; v. (break 的过去式和过去分词) 打破, 破产, 违反

definitions.explanation_en: Having no money or insufficient funds to meet financial obligations; in a state of financial ruin or poverty.
definitions.explanation_cn: 没有钱或资金不足以支付债务；处于经济破产或贫困的状态。
definitions.example_en: After paying all the bills, I'm completely broke until next payday.
definitions.example_cn: 付完所有账单后，我直到下个月发工资前都身无分文。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to separate into pieces, often suddenly or violently, due to physical force or pressure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因外力或压力突然或猛烈地使某物断裂、碎裂。
definitions.example_en: He broke the vase when he knocked it off the shelf.
definitions.example_cn: 他把花瓶从架子上碰掉，打碎了。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to meet a financial obligation; to become bankrupt or insolvent.
definitions.explanation_cn: 无法履行财务义务；宣告破产或资不抵债。
definitions.example_en: The company went broke after years of mismanagement.
definitions.example_cn: 这家公司因多年管理不善而破产了。

definitions.explanation_en: To violate or fail to comply with a law, rule, promise, or agreement.
definitions.explanation_cn: 违反或未能遵守法律、规则、承诺或协议。
definitions.example_en: They broke the terms of the contract by failing to deliver on time.
definitions.example_cn: 他们因未能按时交货而违反了合同条款。

comparison.analysis: “Poor” (贫穷的) 是一个更广泛、更中性的形容词，描述经济状况不佳，但不一定意味着完全没有钱；它可以指生活水平低或收入有限。而 “broke” 更口语化、更极端，强调当下完全没钱，常带有临时性或突发性的含义。
“Cracked” (裂开的) 通常指物体表面出现裂缝但未完全断裂，程度较轻；而 “broke” 表示完全断裂或破坏，结果更彻底。例如：a cracked cup（有裂纹的杯子）vs. a broke cup（杯子碎了）。
“Bankrupt” (破产的) 是法律术语，指经过正式程序宣告无力偿债，具有法律效力；而 “broke” 是日常口语表达，不涉及法律程序，语气更随意。一个人可以说 ‘I’m broke’（我穷得叮当响），但不会说 ‘I’m bankrupt’ 除非真的走完了法律程序。
